title: Naturopathic Medicine — Quest Center for Integrative Health
cleaned_text: Naturopathic Medicine Naturopathic medicine is an integrative, holistic approach to healthcare that focuses on strengthening, supporting, and enhancing the body's ability to regain and maintain health. Naturopathic medicine treats the whole person (physical, mental, emotional, and spiritual factors). The practice addresses the causes of disease and focuses on prevention and wellness. As part of our Medical program, Quest offers Naturopathic medicine emphasizing on prevention, treatment, and optimal health through the use of therapeutic methods that encourage individuals' inherent self-healing process. The practice of naturopathic medicine includes modern and traditional, scientific, and empirical methods. What are the tools/medicines used in Naturopathic Medicine? Lifestyle counseling (nutrition, exercise, sleep, stress management) Vitamin/mineral supplements Herbal (plant) medicine Energetic medicines (homeopathy, flower essences, cell salts) Pharmaceutical drugs (when needed) What can Naturopathic Medicine treat? Cardiovascular disease (e.g. high blood pressure, high cholesterol, varicose veins, etc.) Digestive problems (e.g. gas/bloating, heartburn/reflux, abdominal pain, cramping, nausea, diarrhea, constipation, Irritable Bowel Syndrome, Crohn's, Ulcerative Colitis, Small Intestinal Bacterial Overgrowth, gall bladder problems, liver disease, etc.) Endocrine disease (e.g. thyroid disease, diabetes, etc.) Gynecological problems (e.g. PMS, menopausal symptoms, etc.) Immune related problems (e.g. autoimmune disease, chronic infections, low immunity, etc.) Musculoskeletal problems (e.g. chronic pain, fibromyalgia, arthritis, gout, etc.) Mental health disorders (e.g. anxiety, depression, bipolar disorder, ADHD/ADD, PTSD/trauma, addiction recovery support, etc.) Neurological problems (e.g. headaches/migraines, nerve pain, memory problems, Alzheimer's disease, dementia, Parkinson's, Multiple Sclerosis, etc.) Respiratory conditions (e.g. allergies, cold/flus, sinusitis, asthma, Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease, etc.) Skin conditions (e.g. herpes, eczema, psoriasis, acne, etc.) Stress/fatigue/sleep problems Naturopathic visits are private sessions with your practitioner.
